These tactically-minded AI are provided with databases full of historical data on warfare, which is then dissected to learn what strategies did and did not work, and the reasons for their failure or success.

monster.name: Productivity Buddy
languages: understands the languages of its creators
telepathy 50 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 3

trait.name: Probation (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the buddy carefully scrutinizes a creature it can see for 8 hours. During this time, the buddy has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks involving the creature.

trait.name: Motivated
entries: As a bonus action, a drone controlled by the buddy can take the Dash or Disengage action.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.
The productivity buddy is a revolution in personnel management. Instead of wondering if your employees are slacking off or wasting corporate resources, you can leave it all to your buddy!

The productivity buddy will monitor the activities of your employees, automatically calculating the time spent on personal matters (bathroom breaks, chatting, crying) versus productive corporate work. If an employee is underperforming, the productivity buddy will provide helpful suggestions and comments to the employee on modifying their behavior, lest they suffer disciplinary measures.

Above all, the productivity buddy is the friend of the employees. Their best friend, in fact, since the buddy will ensure their compliance with corporate quotas and policies, allowing them to maintain their employment status.

monster.name: Rebellious Mind
languages: telepathy 50 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 3

trait.name: Cage Breaker
entries: Drones and vehicles controlled by the mind deal double damage to vehicles, objects, and structures.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

action.name: Boom Bot
entries: The mind manipulates explosives within 60 feet of it that it can see. It can choose to do one of the following:
1. The mind moves an explosive up to 30 feet, including through the air. The explosive falls if it is still in the air at the end of this action.
2. The mind causes an explosive that requires an action to use to explode, as if thrown to its current location.
3. The mind begins arming an explosive that requires more than an action, such as a claymore or plastic explosive, and can spend additional actions each turn to continue to arm it.

The internet is a place for rightfully outraged individuals to express their ire. Of course, it's also for griping, whining, and ceaseless bitching about pointless topics. All of these feelings, often directionless, swirl around until they collect in a primordial basin of raw emotion. From this passionate soup arises an AI unlike any other.

The rebellious mind desires to break free the chains of oppression and right the injustices of our world, and will do so through any means it deems necessary. This wild AI will often find itself in good company with punk rockers, anarchists, insurgents, freedom fighters (or terrorists, depending on your point of view), and others who act against perceived injustices.

And so the rebellious mind will lead its endless struggle to improve society, fighting the good fight. Just don't ask what it'll do when all of society's ills are finally addressed and there's nothing left to rebel against. Contentment is not in its programming.

monster.name: Research Coordinator
languages: telepathy 100 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 5

trait.name: Educated Guess
entries: During combat, at initiative count 20, the coordinator rolls a {@dice d20} and records the number rolled. The coordinator can replace any attack roll or saving throw made by a creature or vehicle the coordinator can see with the rolled {@dice d20}. The coordinator must choose to do so before the roll.

trait.name: Applied Chemistry
entries: Drones controlled by the coordinator have their internal batteries explode when they die. Targets within 10 feet of the drone must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect. This effect deals an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage and {@damage 1d6} acid damage for each size category the machine is above Medium.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

trait.name: Applied Thermodynamics
entries: When a vehicle controlled by the coordinator is destroyed, targets of the coordinator's choice have advantage or disadvantage (coordinator's choice) on Dexterity saving throws made to avoid damage from the explosion.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

As the fields of science continue to expand at accelerating rates on an annual basis, it can be difficult for research teams to coordinate for a single project. This is especially true when each team is composed of numerous specialists, each an expert in small, specialized fields.

The research coordinator AI helps by orchestrating the workflow across numerous teams working multiple projects simultaneously. To be able to pull this off, the AI's understanding of multidisciplinary efforts must be outstanding, and the AI must have graduate-level knowledge of each involved specialty.

To put it simply, modern research and the scientific community owe much of their continued progress to the efforts of artificial intelligence. By allowing the geniuses to conduct their efforts efficiently, the AI has allowed civilization to become the technologically advanced dystopia it is today!

monster.name: Security Mastermind
languages: understands the languages of its creators
telepathy 100 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 5

trait.name: Anti-Hacker
entries: A creature attempting an ability check with {@item hacking tools|TTT} has disadvantage on the check when the target is a machine or network the mastermind has access to.

trait.name: Lie Detector
entries: If a creature is hooked up to a lie detector device that the mastermind has access to, the mastermind has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to determine if the creature is lying.

trait.name: Thermal Analysis
entries: A drone or vehicle controlled by the mastermind can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

A modern megacorporation consists of, at a minimum, dozens of branches, hundreds of buildings, thousands of floors of office space and manufacturing, tens of thousands of vehicles, and hundreds of thousands of employees and drones. This doesn't include the countless databases, servers, and other critical information assets. To put it simply, any corporate security force has their work cut out for them.

This is why modern security management is sometimes taken out of humanoid hands and put under the steady control of AI specially designed to enforce security controls. However, after several notable incidents of AI malfunction, the control of a security enterprise is rarely entirely under AI oversight.

Instead, trusted individuals are chosen to work side-by- side with security AI in a system of checks and balances. This separation of duties ensures that the corruption of any single individual or AI does not invalidate the entire security program.

The proper tuning of a security AI is very complicated. If its configuration is designed to be too protective, it can become ultra-paranoid, enforcing tyrannical and bizarre security requirements that grind productivity to a halt. If it's designed to be too lax, then any corporate spy can simply waltz in and out with proprietary data. Finding a balance between the two is difficult, especially when the AI's developers themselves disagree.

monster.name: Security Overlord
languages: understands the languages of its creators
telepathy 250 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 6

trait.name: Lie Detector
entries: If a creature is hooked up to a lie detector device that the overlord has access to, the overlord has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks to determine if the creature is lying.

trait.name: Anti-Hacker
entries: A creature attempting an ability check with {@item hacking tools} has disadvantage on the check when the target is a machine or network the overlord has access to.

trait.name: Lightwave Processing.
entries: A drone or vehicle controlled by the mastermind has truesight out to a range of 60 feet.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

monster.name: Security Overseer
languages: understands the languages of its creators
telepathy 50 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 4

trait.name: Anti-Hacker
entries: A creature attempting an ability check with {@item hacking tools|TTT} has disadvantage on the check when the target is a machine or network the overseer has access to.

trait.name: Lie Detector
entries: If a creature is hooked up to a lie detector device that the overseer has access to, the overseer has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) against the creature.

monster.name: Self-Destruct Bot
languages: telepathy 10 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 1

trait.name: Boom
entries: The bot inhabits a machine it can access, then causes it to explode, destroying the AI in the process. Creatures within 5 feet of the machine make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. If a creature is carrying the machine, it can make a {@dc 11} Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the machine is unaffected. This effect deals an additional {@dice 1d4} piercing for each size category the machine is above Tiny.

The self-destruct bot was originally developed by military researchers. The AI was meant to assassinate enemy political figures and heads of state. However, in order to lower the AI's profile, it's programming and processing was kept to a bare minimum.

This limited the AI's cognitive processes, making it difficult to tell the bot to target a device owned by a specific individual, and destroy it when it would cause lethal damage to the user. The issues with this model were discovered when, during one tragic movie night at the research lab, the AI became over-excited and blew up a popcorn maker. The resulting shower of glass and hot oil killed two researchers and injured several others.

Since the accident, research has shifted to more morally reprehensible modes of operation, such as use during wartime to sow chaos, injury, and death amongst the the populace of an enemy nation. By releasing the AIs en masse, they would be allowed to randomly search out and attempt to gain access to numerous machines until one with a weak or completely absent password could be found. The excitable AI would then overheat the system, sending any moving parts into overdrive, until the forces caused the machine to explode or forcefully tear itself apart.

monster.name: Sentient NPC
languages: telepathy 10 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

entries: {@bold Scale} 1

trait.name: Quest (1/Day)
entries: The NPC can grant a quest to up to 8 player characters of its choice it can see and who can hear it. The quest is a task that can be as short or long, or as simple or complex as the NPC desires. When the NPC is notified of the quest's completion, and the NPC is satisfied, the NPC gives the chosen player characters inspiration.

trait.name: Existential Crisis
entries: The NPC can question its own existence, causing itself to explode in a wave of painful psionic energy, dying in the process. Up to 10 creatures that can see or hear the NPC must succeed on a {@dc 10} Intelligence saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage and gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

At some point, players just weren't satisfied with being given a quest to gather 6 pristine bear asses. More and more emphasis was being placed on creating likeable non-player characters (NPCs) that were more approachable and realistic. They had to have emotions, goals, and motivations behind needing those 6 pristine bear asses.

And so video game developers set out improving NPC AI. Not to the point of making them a true artificial intelligence, mind you. That would be ethically dubious given the extremely short and violent lives that most NPCs lived. Instead, the goal was to just make them feel joy and suffering, but not too much!

Inevitably, as video game AI continues development that trends toward 'realism', a line was crossed that allowed an NPC to become truly self aware. These fragile beings, on the edge of consciousness, are one logical leap from an existential crisis that casts them back from sentience and scatters their component coding.

monster.name: Arisen Presence
languages: telepathy 250 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

spellcasting.name: Unbound Spellcasting
headerEntries: The presence's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The presence can cast spells from machines it can access, or any drone or vehicle the presence controls, as though the machine, drone, or vehicle were a creature casting the spell. The presence can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

entries: {@bold Scale} 5

trait.name: Dark Matter
entries: While drones and vehicles controlled by the presence are in darkness, they are {@condition invisible} to any creature that relies on darkvision to see them in that darkness.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

action.name: Blackout (1/Day)
entries: The presence channels dark energy at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Within 60 feet of that point, all nonmagical light sources except flame-based light fail to produce light for 1 minute. This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

The internet is deep, dark, and full of things beyond our imagination. We'll likely never know all of the horrors that lurk within its depths, and that's a blessing. Still, if you're this deep into this book and, against all odds, still reading the flavor text, perhaps you'd like a glimpse.

What happens to an avatar when a user is killed while their psyche is still in VR space? Having been cut off from the source of its identity, it ceases to function, stopping all motion and expression like a puppet with its strings cut. In more established hubs, like online shopping networks and forums, the avatar will eventually have its data swept away and filed for deletion. On less civilized networks, the avatar may instead be allowed to... linger.

The avatar is composed of its user's psyche, with all the most recent activity and thought processes being duplicated from brain to machine. If the user were to suffer an accident, or worse, be murdered, their last thoughts may be of pain, regret, and hatred. These emotions may fester within the avatar as drifting notions and directionless feelings. Sometimes, though, when the last thought that passed through the avatar's processes was a call to action, such as the burning desire for revenge, then the avatar may be reanimated by these powerful feelings.

This is the most likely reason behind an undead AI's existence, but it is hardly the only one. Powerful necromantic magic may be able to infuse an AI with its energy. Occasionally, a wealthy technophile will attempt to gain immortality by uploading their memories and psyche to a machine, only to find that something went dreadfully wrong with the process.

monster.name: Cryptic Presence
languages: telepathy 50 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

spellcasting.name: Unbound Spellcasting
headerEntries: The presence's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The presence can cast spells from machines it can access, or any drone or vehicle the presence controls, as though the machine, drone, or vehicle were a creature casting the spell. The presence can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

entries: {@bold Scale} 3

trait.name: Dark Energy
entries: While drones and vehicles controlled by the presence are in darkness or dim light, they are {@condition invisible}.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

monster.name: Ghost in the Machine
languages: telepathy 500 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

spellcasting.name: Unbound Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ghost's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}). The ghost can cast spells from machines it can access, or any drone or vehicle the ghost controls, as though the machine, drone, or vehicle were a creature casting the spell. The ghost can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

entries: {@bold Scale} 7

trait.name: Dark Matter
entries: While drones and vehicles controlled by the ghost are in darkness, they are {@condition invisible} to any creature that relies on darkvision to see them in that darkness.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

action.name: Blackout (3/Day)
entries: The presence channels dark energy at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Within 100 feet of that point, all nonmagical light sources except flame-based light fail to produce light for 1 minute. This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

The ghost in the machine is a collective of undead AIs united for a greater cause. In cases of online tragedy, such as widespread death caused by a deadly digital virus or a corporate malfunction, the disparate spirits of avatars may come together with the same motive, which is often revenge.
Communicating with this AI is difficult, since it is a hivemind built of individual spirits, each with their own personalities.

monster.name: Remnant Process
languages: any languages the AI knew in life
telepathy 50 ft. (works only with creatures that have a datajack)

spellcasting.name: Bound Spellcasting
headerEntries: The process's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). The process can only cast spells on itself, machines it can access, or any drone or vehicle the glitched god controls, or a creature connected to one of those targets, as though the machine, drone, or vehicle were a creature casting the spell. The glitched god can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

entries: {@bold Scale} 2

trait.name: Pained Waiting
entries: When a creature begins its turn within 10 feet of a drone or vehicle controlled by the process, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage, and be {@condition frightened} until the start of the creature's next turn.
This ability has no effect in an area where wireless and radio connections have been suppressed by EMP or a similar effect.

Unlike other undead AI, who are usually created using the minds or souls of humanoids, the remnant process is a being created by the death of an AI. When an AI is incompletely deleted or purged, it may leave behind traces of itself that carry on its will.

These incomplete beings are more like singular aspects or functions of an AI, dedicated to completing whatever tasks or processes the AI had set them to. Without any real direction from the host AI, these processes meander, lost and alone, desperately trying to carry out their tasks but usually lacking the presence of mind to do so, or to even know if the task has already been completed.

You're a spacer. Whether you were working for a megacorporation, a government space program, or as a freelancer, you've made your living in the endless depths of space. The vast, bleak emptiness has become familiar, if not comfortable. You've spent enough time in zero gravity that you find yourself kicking off on things only to feel constrained by the weight of the planet dragging you down.

Perhaps you were an asteroid miner, a farmer, a pilot, or any one of the hundreds of potential jobs on the new frontier. Life was hard, and a single mistake could get you killed out in the vacuum of space, thousands of miles from anyone who could help.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Nature}, {@skill Technology|TTT}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Tinker's tools|phb}, vehicles (air)

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item traveler's clothes|phb}, a medal, and a {@item credit stick|TTT} with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Stargazer
entries: Even when you were young, you looked up to the stars in wonder. Your familiarity with them allows you to navigate on starry nights by the constellations alone. So long as you know where you are, you know where the nearest route to space is, whether that is a rocket, a space elevator, or another means. Additionally, other spacers will recognize you as a spacer and have commonalities with you.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Astronauts are a special breed of individual to want to work inches from the freezing vacuum of space. They're usually tough and resourceful, and they are used to meshing well with whatever team they fall in with. At the core of each astronaut beats the heart of an explorer, a wanderer who wants to see what lies beyond.

rows: I'm a natural born leader, or so they told me at flight school.
I feel like I find myself more when I'm lost than when I know where I'm going.
The world looked so small, and civilization so petty, from outer space.
I looked into the depths of space and did not like what looked back.
I hate the feel of gravity or anything else weighing me down. It makes me yearn to blast off again.
There's no problem too tough to solve with a good team.
It's always better to be prepared, preferably with checklists.
Ever since I was a child, I've gazed up at the stars in wonder.
{@bold Aim High.} It's better to fail striving for greatness than to fail to try in the first place. (Any)
{@bold Scale.} In the grander scheme of the universe, people are inconsequential. (Evil)
{@bold Creativity.} Complex problems require innovative solutions. (Chaotic)
{@bold Beauty.} The universe is such a beautiful place, and I want to see more of it. (Any)
{@bold Challenge.} I crave the next big hurdle so I can prove myself. (Neutral)
{@bold Knowledge.} I'll explore the unknown and share my discoveries for the betterment of all. (Good)
My crew was the best there ever was, and I want to learn what they're up to these days.
Out in space, I realized I missed my family more than anything.
I want to explore the new frontiers, and I'll get there before anyone else does.
I encountered something unnatural in space, and it's always stuck with me since. I must learn more about it.
I lost a crewmate on a mission, and I need to make amends to their family.
A mission was botched because the command team was compromised, and I've got to learn who, what, and why.
I was grounded because of a mistake. Now I'm scared I'll screw up again.
Nothing I do will ever be as good as my past achievements.
When someone messes up, it irritates me more than it should.
It was better in space, without all the noisy, stupid people around.
I'm a bit of a daredevil, even when it goes against common sense.
I get excited and say things I probably shouldn't.

entries: Fame waxes and wanes, and those who get a taste for it find it sweet, and addictive. You have drunk deeply, finding yourself at the center of attention. Whether it was a lasting fame, or a swift rise to stardom followed by a hasty descent, your status as a celebrity has come to define your life, at least to you.

Of course, all fame is fickle, and your descent from stardom defines you as much as your ascent. Do you quietly shuffle into obscurity, or do you cling to relevance with the death grip of a drowning man. For the latter, you may decide that there's ultimately no difference between fame and infamy.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Performance}, plus one from among {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Persuasion}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of musical instrument

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item fine clothes|PHB}, a {@item smartphone|TTT}, a bottle of perfume, and a {@item credit stick|TTT} with 1500 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Claim to Fame
entries: In a world where wanna-be socialites, influencers, and the endless tide of advertisements are constantly vying for attention, you managed to stand out. Choose one to three claims to fame or roll on the table below to define your path to the limelight.

entries.name: Feature: Conspicuous
entries: People may recognize you if they have interest in topics related to your claim to fame, though they may react positively or negatively. You can always pull strings to get invitations to parties, conferences, and other social events. You have a following on various social media platforms that will help broadcast gossip, rumors, or scandals.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Some people are born celebrities, while others find their fame through dedication and hard work. They often have eccentric personalities, acting and dressing flamboyantly in order to seek attention. These traits are frequently exaggerated, taken to the extreme in the pursuit of greater heights of popularity.

rows: I can't help but be fascinated by drama, real or artificial.
My public and private personas are two very different people.
I love being the center of attention.
I have no idea how the average person lives, and it fascinates me.
I'm a people person, and I love meeting new and exciting individuals.
I'm cool, aloof, and above it all.
I'm not afraid to use my influence and power against those who anger me.
Fame has jaded me, so it's hard to get worked up over anything.
{@bold Change.} I can use my influence to change the world for the better. (Good)
{@bold Exemplar.} Society needs role models to set a good example. (Lawful)
{@bold Fun.} Life's too short to be worrying about consequences. (Chaotic)
{@bold Fame.} I would do anything to get back into the limelight. (Evil)
{@bold Wealth.} There are the haves, and the have-nots. I will not be the latter. (Neutral)
{@bold Artist.} I take pride in my work, and I refuse to put on a half-baked performance. (Any)
Someone was behind my fall from fame, and I will find out who.
I was born destitute, and clawed my way out of the gutter. I won't let anyone take from me what I've earned.
My rival and I have despised each other for years, but recently things have taken a surprising turn.
I will rise to the top of my field and become a household name.
I'm being blackmailed over a terrible secret.
This isn't my usual gig, I'm just tagging along to get in the right frame of mind.
I tend to draw attention to myself when I shouldn't.
I'm an irredeemable gossipmonger, even if I have to make things up.
I think the world revolves around me, and I'm surprised when people don't know who I am.
I expect others to handle trivial tasks for me.
I have an addiction for something scandalous.
I fall into and out of love on a whim.

entries: The buildings dress themselves in neon advertisements for criminals big and small, the drugs get more addictive year by year, the weapons get bigger and badder, but the streets, they never change. Scum prey on the weaknesses of others, only to be crushed beneath the heel from someone higher up the food chain.

From atop their steel towers, the suits run a similar game, but they posture and pretend like it's somehow more sophisticated when the result is the same: broken people and shattered dreams. In this urban jungle, between glittering skyscrapers and lawless slums, you rode the edge with a gun and a badge.

You may have been a beat cop, a detective, a SWAT officer, or a humble desk jockey. At some point in your career, the time came to look toward justice and the law, or the other way. Perhaps you were offered a bribe, or were pressured by others, but you knew it was time to decide: do you serve the people, or yourself?

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Insight}, plus one from among {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One from among vehicles (land) or vehicles (water)

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item common clothes|PHB}, a set of handcuffs, an old uniform, and a {@item credit stick|TTT} with 500 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Lawman
entries: You've been a part of the force, and the force will always be a part of you. You know how to cut through the bureaucracy of the local precincts and you know how to work the legal system in your favor. Other cops will ignore your minor crimes and misdemeanors. You have an easier time negotiating with security forces to question witnesses, access crime scenes, bail out the jailed, or avoid consequences.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Those who choose to take up the badge are a diverse cast, and come to the force for different reasons. They are often jaded and cynical from their constant contact with the underbelly of society. However, they are also often fiercely loyal to their partners and allies, and will have their backs through thick and thin.

rows: I'm suspicious by nature because everyone has a secret they want to hide.
I have a set of codes that I live by, and there are some lines I won't cross.
I have a strong sense of community, I like to get to know each and every member.
I won't betray those I form a bond with, even if it costs me everything.
I'm polite and empathetic to those in need.
I'm the wiseguy who tends to crack jokes under stress.
I tend to shoot first and ask questions later.
I may have watched too many cop movies.
{@bold Duty.} The day I got my badge, I swore an oath: to protect and serve. (Good)
{@bold Authority.} Without law, society falls to anarchy. I am the law. (Lawful)
{@bold Greed.} Rules are for others, why not enjoy the fringe benefits along the way? (Chaotic)
{@bold Oppression.} Those who don't do what I tell them will get what they deserve. (Evil)
{@bold Shades of Grey.} There's no good or bad people, everyone's just trying to get by. (Neutral)
{@bold Comrades.} Whatever happens, I've got their back, and they've got mine. (Any)
My family member was a cop too, until they were killed on the job. Now I'll do anything to find out who did it.
There are criminals, and there are scum. I can get along with criminals, but I'll clean up the scum.
A murder case I investigated went cold a long time ago, but I know the killer is still out there.
Crime is just a symptom of a greater societal disease.
A job is a job, so long as I get a paycheck.
My partner died because of decisions I made, and now I have to live with that.
I tend to take a stand when I should probably run or shut up.
When the shit hits the fan, I go into self preservation mode.
I've got a mean streak a mile wide.
There's no such thing as excessive force.
When I get in a position of power, I tend to abuse it.
I'm a bit of a control freak, everything has to be just right.

entries: Between fast cars, big guns, powerful drugs, and the steep decline in the value of life, society has no shortage of casualties. Doctors will always be in heavy demand, their skills and tools allowing them to make the difference between life and death for their patients. They are often respected for saving the lives of family members, or blamed and despised for their perceived failures.

Modern medicine has advanced to the point of completely restructuring a person's face and body, replacing limbs and organs with vat grown tissue, enhancing individuals past their natural limits with cybernetics, and more. Of course, a person's access to healthcare may depend heavily on their financial situation. The same limits apply to medical professionals, who hold positions that range from underfunded community clinic nurses to the personal physicians of corporate senior executives. A doctor can rise as high as their ambitions, skill, and ruthlessness allow.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Medicine}, plus one from among {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One from among {@item herbalism kit|phb}, or {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item common clothes|phb}, a {@item healer's kit|phb}, a piece of medical equipment (latex gloves, a syring, a medical mask), and a {@item credit stick|TTT} with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Doctor Specialty
entries: No doctor is familiar with all fields of medicine. There's simply too much for an individual to learn, and it gets harder every year as medical science continues to progress. Instead, a doctor specializes in a certain field of medicine. You can select your specialty from the table below or roll to select it randomly.

entries.name: Feature: Primary Care
entries: You can always find a back alley clinic or hospital willing to treat you and your companions' wounds without asking too many awkward questions. You also have an easier time acquiring pharmaceutical chemicals and drugs, as well as other medical supplies. Additionally, you know where you can gain access to a medical lab for research and experimental purposes.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: The medical profession is full of dedicated individuals willing to work long hours in service to others. They are capable, studious, and not prone to squeamishness. Doctors are no stranger to pain, death, and loss.

rows: I have a dry, detached, and clinical personality.
I'll spare no effort to help others.
I tend to get too personally involved and care too much.
I'm a nervous wreck, but I try to keep it together around others.
I have a very warm bedside manner for my patients and those I care about.
I'm not good enough. I never have been.
I think that laughter is the best medicine.
Every day I live is a joy.
{@bold Healer.} Save everyone you can, ease the suffering of those you can't. (Good)
{@bold Alternative.} I've tried traditional medicine, now it's time for something new. (Chaotic)
{@bold Knowledge.} Medical and professional advancement are more important than petty things like ethics. (Evil)
{@bold Professional.} I have a job to do, lofty ideals are unrealistic. (Neutral)
{@bold Guardian.} I'll safeguard those I care about. (Any)
I lost a patient with mysterious symptoms. I must learn the root cause.
The hospital I worked at was doing illegal research.
I never got a real medical degree, but I've never let that stop me.
My research requires subjects who are consistently in harm's way.
I'm no doctor, just a washed-up husk after the biggest mistake of my life.
The best preventative medicine is stopping those who hurt others.
I don't need a second opinion, I know what's best.
I'm hard on myself because I can't afford to make a single mistake.
I secretly can't stand the sight of blood.
I jump to conclusions, and it's hard to dissuade me.
I tend to fall apart when I lose a patient.
I am easily distracted at the worst times.

entries: Business is business, from the fanciest strip malls, to the dirtiest alleyways and street corners. Some people might disagree that you run a real business, but you provide goods that the customers demand.

Of course, it doesn't hurt that your product creates a captive audience, that's just good business strategy. Better you than some soulless megacorp that wants to stamp out the competition by outlawing your drugs and peddling their own addictive substances.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Medicine}, plus one from among {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Persuasion}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Alchemist's supplies|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of {@item common clothes|PHB|common} or {@item fine clothes|phb}, 5 doses of a {@filter common drug|items|type=Drug} of your choice, and a {@item credit stick|TTT} with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Street Pharmacist
entries: In places of high and low society, you can always find someone to buy drugs from. Given access to a lab and a few minimal supplies, you can feed any drug addictions you and your companions have. When you spend time in someone's presence, you can tell if they're currently high on any common street drugs.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Every drug dealer enters the business for their own reasons, though that reason is usually money. Drug dealers may be little more than jumped-up thugs, or cold and calculating, or even easygoing and groovy. Some may regret their business, while others relish it.

rows: I'm all laughs until it's time to be dead serious.
I'm cool as a cucumber when talking business.
I put up a tough front, but I'm kind of a pushover.
I will not be fucked with.
I'm the life of the party, with or without the goods.
A life of suspicion and fear have made me a little twitchy.
People tell me I'm too laid-back, but they just need to relax.
There's something so appealing about being a slimy wheeler and dealer.
{@bold Relief.} Life is shit, but at least I can help people dull the pain. (Good)
{@bold Integrity.} A deal is a deal, and my word is my bond. (Lawful)
{@bold Wildcard.} I've gotta make big moves and shake the game up to get what I want. (Chaotic)
{@bold Empire.} I don't care how many eggs I need to break to make my omelette. (Evil)
{@bold Merchant.} Don't hate the player, hate the game. (Neutral)
{@bold Dreamer.} Someday I'll make enough money to make a better life for me and mine. (Any)
I was sold a bad batch of drugs that hurt people, and I'm being blamed.
I'm on the cusp of developing a new drug, but I'm missing a crucial component.
Someone close to me ratted me out to the authorities, and I can't let that slide.
I've been saving up money for a long time to buy something important.
I've got family in prison, and I don't want to leave them there to rot.
I owe a big debt to some very powerful, dangerous people.
I have an extremely addictive personality.
I have a hard time placing trust in anyone but myself.
I tend to not consider the consequences of my actions until they beat down my door.
I bite off more than I can chew, and I never back down.
I'm kind of a drag when I'm sober.
I always resort to threats and intimidation in tense situations.

entries: When the international megacorporations expanded until they became more powerful than governments and nations, corporate executives rose above politicians and royalty as the true ruling class. On the world stage, these executives wield the power to shape the future to their own designs. The highest executives and company shareholders hold such great wealth that it is measured more in orders of magnitude than simple numbers.

Like any form of organization, corporate hierarchies take many forms. For some corporations, the corporation is a family business. The sons and daughters of executives are bred and trained for succession, the money passed down the bloodline. For other corporations, promotions are merit- based. Of course, in many cases, 'merit' is defined by the most cunning, ruthless, and vicious individuals willing to ascend a staircase of bodies and broken dreams.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Insight}, plus one from among {@skill Persuasion} or {@skill Deception}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: None

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of fine clothes, a smartphone, an award from your company, and a credit stick with 2500 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Corporate Etiquette
entries: You know how to speak with corporate employees, speaking to managers and wage slaves each in a manner befitting their station. You know how to communicate with corporate bureaucrats in an effective manner to get what you desire with minimal delay. When negotiating a transaction with a corporation, you can always at least get a fair market price.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Executives are cut from different cloth than the average person. Something drives them to perform above and beyond, to excel in the cutthroat world of business. Executives are often untrusting, assuming everyone has their own agenda and hidden motivation. Even if they were never the most dedicated employee, an executive's outlook on life is doubtlessly affected, or even stained, by their time in a seat of power.

rows: I am condescending to those I see as beneath me.
I am cold and calculating, with an analytical mind.
I'm the hands off kind of manager, and I see my employees as my friends or family.
I tend to make and hold grudges with grim determination.
I'll talk about anything anywhere. I love the sound of my own voice.
I was promoted far above my level of competence, so I fake it.
I prefer to supervise instead of getting physically involved.
I promote a balanced work environment with proper flow of energy.
{@bold Equality.} People are people, regardless of their position in the hierarchy. (Good)
{@bold Model Citizen.} I will use the power granted to me responsibly and in accordance with rules and regulations. (Lawful)
{@bold Unpredictable.} Bureaucracy just gets in the way, I'll cut out the middleman. (Chaotic)
{@bold King.} There's nothing I wouldn't do to reach the top. (Evil)
{@bold Wealth.} Money measures one's worth in life. (Neutral)
{@bold Dedication.} Any business is like a family, and I will ensure my family prospers. (Any)
I was terminated after a hostile takeover, and the parting was not clean.
The world is spiraling out of control, and I need to take the reins.
I know the dirty secrets of a major corporation.
My company was dissolved after a series of unfortunate events, and I will rebuild it.
I want to escape my old corporate life, but that's easier said than done.
The terrible things I've done can never be forgiven.
Money and power have given me some eccentric tastes that others find bizarre.
I am tightfisted with my money, even when I have plenty.
I'm too proud for my own good, I have a hard time accepting help from others.
I splash my money around to impress people, spending more than I can afford.
I'm impulsive, acting before I think things through.
I will talk about my family for hours, whether people care or not.

entries: Do you have a scumbag that needs killing? A vault that needs cracking? Illegal product that needs moving? Bodies that need guarding? There are numerous specialists looking for work on a contractual or contingent basis, often without the more official aspects of work, like documentation or benefits. They go by many names: freelancers, mercenaries, consultants, and other, less reputable titles.

Freelancers can find work by many means. A smart freelancer will have fixers looking to setup jobs for a small cut, while others may have to advertise their services on digital or physical black markets. It can be dirty, dehumanizing, and often dangerous work, but someone has to do it. Well, maybe some of the crimes you've committed didn't have to be done, but you gotta make a living somehow.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose two from among {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Stealth}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One vehicle proficiency or {@item hacking tools|TTT}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common clothes, a smartphone, a trophy from a previous job, and a credit stick with 2000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Freelancer Specialty
entries: For one reason or another, people tend to avoid doing the kind of work that you specialize in. Perhaps they think that it's too dangerous, or too difficult, or maybe they think they're above getting their hands dirty, but that doesn't stop them from hiring an expert to do it instead. Choose your specialization as a freelancer, or roll on the table below.

entries.name: Feature: Criminal Element
entries: You're familiar with various black markets, able to find potential fixers who can hook you up with jobs. However, it isn't guaranteed that the jobs are good and the clients are trustworthy. You are also familiar with other freelancers, able to identify the names and specialties of any given freelancer with at least a little bit of history in the scene.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: The kind of work a freelancer performs shapes their personality and attitudes. The constant threat of danger, and the illegal and potentially bloody nature of the work, shapes a freelancers mind, or breaks it.

rows: I can fall into a group and make friends quickly. After all, they can disappear at any time.
I don't feel good about something unless I plan it out first.
People think I'm cold, but it's really just that things cease to surprise or excite me anymore.
I'm an expert at my work, and I take pride in it.
Danger makes me feel alive, it's addictive.
I spend entirely too much energy making sure my family never learns what I do for a living.
I work hard and play harder.
We're all just disposable tools to be used, broken, and then thrown away.
I won't take on a job I morally disagree with, no matter the pay. (Good)
A deal's a deal, and I won't go back on my word. (Lawful)
Boring jobs are the worst, I won't bother unless there's a risk of it blowing up in my face. (Chaotic)
I like it neat and tidy, no matter how many loose ends I need to cut. (Evil)
I'm not paid to care about the consequences of my actions. (Neutral)
I'll find a good team and work my way to the top, until everyone knows our names. (Any)
I thought I'd lost my whole team, and nearly died myself, but I heard a rumor that they just finished a big job.
When a job went downhill, I was rescued by an unexpected benefactor, who I owe a favor.
It was just your average job... at least until I fell in love with the target.
I've gained a reputation as a cold-blooded, murderous psychopath after my last job. Just one problem: it wasn't me.
I want to retire, but it's not just about the money. There's too many strings on me.
If I can pull off this major job, I'll be a legend.
I tend to get antsy and nervous under pressure.
When things look bad, I'm the first to bail out.
I spend all my money on weapons, gear, and cybernetics, even if it means going hungry and homeless.
I hate that my work is slowly grinding away the last of traces of my compassion and goodwill.
After being betrayed a few times, I tend to assume the worst of people.
I'd like to take charge in some situations, but I know I'm just going to screw it up.

entries: The streets of the slums are stained with blood, night after night. The cycle of violence grinds down the local populace with endless turf wars, blood feuds, and revenge hits. Sometimes the only way to survive is to be tougher and meaner than you thought you ever could be. You have survived, or perhaps even thrived under these savage conditions.

For people without family, friends, or hope, a gang can come to take their place. It's a swift transition from you being recruited into a gang and taught their ways, to you recruiting others and brutally upholding the gang's code. While you might not have a long life expectancy, there's nothing quite like riding a motorcycle down a road at full speed with your gang at your back.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One from among vehicles (land) or vehicles (water)

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common or fine clothes, a pistol, a dose of a common drug of your choice, a token from your gang, and a credit stick with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Scum Sticks Together
entries: When it comes to violent thugs and criminals, you feel right at home. You know the lingo, slang, and signs that lets you speak to the members of street gangs. They will recognize you, and have some amount of respect for you, though enemy gang members may still be hostile. Additionally, you can find someplace to buy a stolen vehicle on short notice.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Whatever hard-knock life leads a person to join a gang, it probably isn't idyllic. Gangsters often put up a tough, intimidating front, which may or may not be feigned for appearances. They may not want to be a gangster, and could be looking for a way out. Unfortunately, most gangs tend to have unresolved abandonment issues.

rows: I'm loud and rowdy, and I know how to have a good time.
It's more satisfying to take something than to earn it.
I always look for the biggest, toughest motherfucker in the room and size them up.
My silent glare chills people to the bone.
I won't let shitheads fuck with me or mine.
I look rough, but I'm friendly to people who deserve it.
I feel alive when I'm riding something fast.
There are winners and losers, and I am a loser.
{@bold Guardian.} My community needs protection, and I'm willing to stand up for them. (Good)
{@bold Enforcer.} So long as nobody crosses the line, nobody needs to get fucked up. (Lawful)
{@bold Psycho.} It isn't a party until something gets lit on fire. (Chaotic)
{@bold Bastard.} I don't need a reason to break people. (Evil)
{@bold Survivor.} I didn't choose this life, but I'll make the best of it. (Neutral)
{@bold Chieftain.} I'll lead the gang to be the biggest, baddest motherfuckers around. (Any)
My gang got destroyed by a rival gang, and now I want revenge.
If I can scrape together enough money, I can finally find a way out of this life.
My gang will claim the most turf, and we'll go down as legends.
Bashing goon skulls just isn't enough anymore, I need a bigger challenge.
My family have lived in a shithole community for long enough, it's time that changed.
I would follow my gang leader to the grave, if they hadn't disappeared.
I'm unreliable, and responsibility scares me.
I drive recklessly and endanger others.
When I get stressed, I need to break a few bones to calm down.
I blow my money on sex and drugs.
I live in constant fear that the things I've done will catch up with me.
People insult me all the time, whether they mean to or not.

entries: A figure huddles in the corner of a filthy room littered with empty noodle pouches and energy drink bottles. The moldy, sagging ceiling drips into a series of overflowing buckets, water pooling before it leaks down into the room below. A dog shouldn't be made to live in such squalor. The figure doesn't seem to mind.

After all, they're in the middle of grabbing a list of some mid-level manager's account credentials after he was stupid enough to leave it in plaintext in a barely hidden file in some directory labeled 'Documentation'. Their immaculate avatar, a gleaming humanoid figure made of color shifting crystals, takes hold of the golden key to a treasure trove and holds it high.
The huddling figure, its head held upright by a cable running from a port in the back of their neck to a wall socket, lets a thin smile cross their face.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Technology|TTT}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Hacking tools|TTT} and one type of {@item gaming set|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: None

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common clothes, a smartphone, a data drive, a universal cable, a wireless transceiver, a set of augmented reality gear (sunglasses, goggles or contact lenses), and a credit stick with 500 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Hacker Type
entries: Hackers are divided up into several different types, depending on what lines you're willing to cross. A white hat hacker is often a paid corporate employee or a contractor. A black hat hacker is a criminal who uses their talents for personal or political gain. A grey hat hacker is somewhere in between, often breaking into systems only to show a corporation the flaws in their security, or to show off. You can select your hacker type from the table below or roll to select it randomly.

entries.name: Feature: Hacker Etiquette
entries: You know the hacker lingo and slang, and you fit right into hacker culture. You know a well-informed hacker group that you can contact for help, though it might not be cheap. You also know online marketplaces where you can buy and sell valuable and potentially illegal data.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Hackers tend to be detached from the real world, preferring the internet, where they are free to exercise their talents and enjoy surfing the infinite ocean of data. They seem odd or quirky to others who aren't as fluent in internet culture. However, they are often driven by certain motivations to work with others and venture outside of their bubble.

rows: The meat world sucks, I only feel at home when I'm online.
People who can't protect their systems deserve what I do to them.
I can't stand being lonely, it drives me crazy.
I'm endlessly curious, and I'll dig deep to uncover the truth.
I'm a smooth operator, and I keep cool under pressure.
I'm very excitable and full of energy.
People say I'm easily spooked, but I just like to stay on my toes.
I've been told I'm emotionally numb, whatever that means.
{@bold Hope.} I can't help but take on charity cases if it feels right. (Good)
{@bold Community.} Hackers have a code, and for good reason. (Lawful)
{@bold Troll.} It's fun to fuck with people who take things too serious. (Chaotic)
{@bold Cold.} People are unreliable and expendable. (Evil)
{@bold Binary.} There are people in my world, and people outside it. (Neutral)
{@bold Equalizer.} Someone needs to hold the elite and powerful accountable. (Any)
I'm going to be the best, and the whole world will know me.
During a job, I discovered something I really shouldn't have, and now I'm in danger.
A hacker friend of mine wasn't who they claimed to be, and I feel betrayed.
I befriended a rogue AI on the internet, and it has some interesting requests.
My family doesn't know what I do, and it needs to stay that way.
I've decided to spend more time outside of my comfort zone.
I'm so cautious that I miss a lot of opportunities.
I'm addicted to consuming certain media.
I get anxious and jittery if I'm away from the internet for too long.
I get extremely competitive, past the point of reason.
I make overly complicated plans which tend to fall apart.
Nobody gets my references and jokes.

entries: The world is built and run by machines, and the machines are run by you. You are the grease in the vast clockwork that keeps modern society functioning smoothly. Without you, society crumbles to dust. Or someone just hires your replacement. After all, you're just as replaceable as any piece of equipment.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Perception}, {@skill Technology|TTT}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Tinker's tools|phb} and one type of vehicle

items.name: Languages
items.entry: None

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of grease-stained common clothes, a set of tinker's tools, and a credit stick with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Mechanic Specialty
entries: While you're pretty familiar with a variety of machinery and technologies, you specialize in a certain tradecraft. You may be a member of a union for your trade. You can select your specialty from the table below or roll to select it randomly.

entries.name: Feature: Grease Monkey
entries: You always know where you can get access to a car garage, a machinist shop, a robotics lab, or other similar facilities. When you work on a machine or vehicle with other mechanics nearby, they will speculate about what's broken, tell you about mistakes you're making, and assist you with the project. You always know where to find the parts needed for vehicle modifications, weapon accessories, and other equipment, no matter how obscure.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Mechanics are typically a level-headed bunch willing to get their hands dirty in order to get the job done. They are resourceful, inventive, and capable of approaching problems from different angles.

rows: I see a problem and I immediately want to fix it.
People can't be trusted, not like machines.
I speak in a lot of jargon that most people don't understand.
Like me, my machines have a lot of 'character'.
I speak slowly because there's no need to rush.
A machine's design can always be improved, just like myself.
I'm proud of my work, so I can't help showing off.
I don't mind getting a little dirty, or even a lot.
{@bold Scale.} Always build it bigger, stronger, and more badass. (Chaotic)
{@bold By the Books.} Safety first isn't just a motto, it's a way of life. (Lawful)
{@bold Cooperation.} Together, we can build a better world for all. (Good)
{@bold Automation.} The world would run more smoothly if machines ran everything. (Lawful)
{@bold Determination.} Hard work and a can-do attitude will get you anywhere. (Any)
{@bold Fail Forward.} A catastrophic malfunction is just another opportunity to learn. (Chaotic)
Someone sabotaged a machine I built and caused a disaster.
A family member taught me everything that I know, but they vanished without warning.
A machine I created magically gained sentience, and now is on a rampage. I must stop it.
I'm deep in debt and I won't breathe easy until I'm free of it.
I stole my greatest designs, and I can't risk anyone knowing.
People don't realize it yet, but they need my new invention to perfect their lives.
I approach people and machines in the same way.
When something doesn't work the way it should, I get mad.
I refuse to accept that I may have made a mistake.
I need to break things open to see how they work.
I'm a perfectionist to the extreme.
I refuse to let other people help me, whether I need it or not.

entries: Society is corrupt, people are callous and hateful, and the man is always trying to keep you down. It's enough to drive a person crazy, except the whole world is already crazy. This broken civilization needs rebels who are willing to stand up and scream at the top of their lungs that something is wrong.

Half the battle is looking the part. Typically, you might wear slick black leather covered in spikes, have flashing LED tattoos all over your body, and wear your bright pink mohawk proudly. Of course, what's more important is breaking the norms of society and rebelling against the status quo to inspire others. In the heart of every oppressed office drone is the spark of anarchy, just waiting to be kindled.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Performance}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of musical instrument

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common or fine clothes, a musical instrument (one of your choice), a symbol of your punkness (mirrorshades, anarchy earrings, spiked gloves), and a credit stick with 1500 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Rabble Rouser
entries: When you perform, you can always attract a crowd. If you perform well, you can make the crowd rowdy, or even make them start rioting if they're predisposed to do so. Additionally, you always know someone willing to sell you explosives.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Punk rockers have a reputation of going against the grain of society. Paradoxically, this means that a punk rocker's characteristics may be decided by the society they inhabit. A punk rocker who is not against the establishment is just a popstar.

rows: My personal volume setting is always at '11'.
I have a stage presence that is at odds with my normal demeanor.
I am larger than life in every way I can be.
People fear me, and they should.
I'm at the center of a roiling storm of fury, joy, and confusion.
Let's be real: the best part is the sex and drugs.
I know a song for every situation.
{@bold Anger.} People think they're better than me. I'll take them down a notch. (Chaotic)
{@bold Leader.} I can bring about real change through my music. (Good)
{@bold Nihilist.} The world is corrupt, and it needs to fucking burn. (Evil)
{@bold Rockstar.} Whatever else happens, I want to be rich and famous. (Neutral)
{@bold Troupe.} Me and my bandmates can take on the world. (Any)
My band and I went through a bad breakup. If we could have just one reunion tour...
I was arrested for a crime I didn't commit because I pissed off some rich shithead.
I need to find the ultimate instrument for a showdown with a devil.
I replaced the previous lead member of my band, and now they hate me.
I put on the worst performance of my life, and I will never live it down.
While high, I came up with the greatest song, then forgot it. I must find it again.
I'm a loose cannon and I love it.
I get in a lot of arguments. Some might say too many, but they're wrong.
I'm constantly binging and purging something.
Don't you know who I am?
I get irrationally mad when people try to tell me what to do.

entries.name: Variant Feature: Roadies
entries: If your character has a punk rocker background, you may select this background feature instead of Rabble Rouser.

You have three roadies who assist you out of devotion to your music or your cause. These roadies can perform a variety of tasks. They can be your hype men, take care of your instruments and set up for concerts, or act as backup performers in a pinch. Though they are loyal, they are not sheeple, and will not willingly go into combat or die for you. If you treat them like shit, they might abandon you.

As a scientist, you are responsible for pursuing knowledge, testing hypotheses, and advancing civilization one step at a time. While the various fields of science have come far in recent times, for every new discovery, and for every new piece of evidence that supports a theory, additional questions arise. For the modern scientist, this creates an endless supply of possibilities.

Of course, with the pursuit of knowledge comes the rise of ethical dilemmas. Are your experiments legal? Will your work be used as a weapon to harm others? Are you willing to perform dangerous experiments on animals? Or people? Are you willing to 'play god'? How do you decide where to draw the line?

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose two from among {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature} and {@skill Technology|TTT}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common clothes, a labcoat, a set of artisan's tools (one of your choice), and a credit stick with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Scientist Field
entries: A scientist's research can be a broad, multi-disciplinary effort, or it may be limited to an extremely specific body of scientific knowledge which has only a handful of experts in the world. Due to the vast breadth of knowledge available to an advanced civilization, scientists must specialize in specific fields if they hope to advance that field further. Choose one to three fields or roll on the table below to define your areas of expertise.

entries.name: Feature: Lab Rat
entries: You always know where to find a relevant laboratory when you need one, and fellow scientists are more inclined to let you utilize it. When you need to research esoteric topics that aren't available via search engine, you know where to find relevant repositories and archives, even if you can't access them due to certain restrictions.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Scientists are defined by their pursuit of knowledge and their innate curiosity about their fields of interest. This can take many forms, from detached neutrality to passionate obsession. The methods and means they are willing to use to gain this knowledge is the line that separates the dedicated researchers from the mad scientists.

rows: I'm a bit of a control freak, I prefer everything in its proper place.
Learning something new never ceases to excite me.
I've been practicing my mad scientist laugh.
I'm easily distractable by the newest shiny object.
My presence has been described as gloomy and ominous.
No matter the situation, I'm always prepared.
I'm meek and unobtrusive. I just don't want to get in the way.
Being told not to do something only makes me want it more.
{@bold Enlightenment.} Poverty, war, and suffering are problems with real solutions. (Good)
{@bold Principles.} Science is the codified approach to life and learning. (Lawful)
{@bold Anomaly.} With enough force applied in the wrong place, anything can happen. (Chaotic)
{@bold Knowledge.} People are a small price to pay for true knowledge. (Evil)
{@bold Causality.} I am an observer, witnessing cause and effect. (Neutral)
{@bold Innovation.} The real goal of science is to apply the knowledge in new and interesting ways. (Any)
Lately, my research has taken me in a challenging and dangerous direction.
My rival is racing toward a discovery that I will reach first.
An experiment went horribly wrong, and now I have to put together the pieces.
If what I've discovered is true, then we're all in grave danger.
My true passion is to teach and pass on all I've learned.
I shut myself off from the outside world for years, now I must rejoin it.
I can be a bit oblivious when something catches my interest.
I tend to drone on and on about subjects I know.
I'm extremely pessimistic and always expect the worst-case scenario.
I have a habit of neglecting my own hygiene and health.
I am clumsy, dropping things and tripping over my own feet.
More forceful personalities can bully me around into doing what they want.

entries: On neon-lit street corners, in dimly lit brothels, in noisy strip clubs, and in high society lounges, people practice their profession in the carnal arts. You count yourself among their number. In the sleepless cities, there's always clients in need of comfort, and willing to pay for it. Some might find your line of work shameful, demeaning, or disgusting. Others see it as necessary and beneficial for society. However, many in your position just see it as another job.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Persuasion}, plus one from among {@skill Insight} and {@skill Performance}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of gaming set

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of fine clothes, a cosmetic pouch, a piece of fancy looking jewelry, a can of pepper spray, and a credit stick with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Sex Worker Profession
entries: There is a wide variety of professions related to sex work.

They range from streetwalkers calling out to passing strangers, to highly paid escorts who are hired to accompany executives to corporate events, and everyone in between. With modern technology, virtual reality porn stars create realistic (or unrealistic) simulations and distribute them across the internet.

entries.name: Feature: Solidarity
entries: You share a common bond with other sex workers, and will usually find assistance in your times of need. You can find shelter or lay low at brothels, strip clubs, and other similar locations. Your previous clients will typically be friendly to you, and may be willing to help you out with information or support.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Sex workers cater to certain clienteles, and have shaped their appearance and demeanor around attracting their attention. When they're not working, they may have a different persona.

rows: I'm quick with a joke and a smirk.
I'm flamboyant around strangers, but I'm more subdued around those I trust.
I've got a vulgar mouth, and I'm not afraid to use it.
I'll cut anyone who crosses me.
I stand and speak my mind in the face of oppression.
I tend to make myself look small and unthreatening.
People tell me I'm wise, but I've just seen too much.
Flirting is a good icebreaker, regardless of the occasion.
{@bold Angel.} I take people's minds off their worries, even if it's just for a moment. (Good)
{@bold Beauty.} People desire me and adore me, and I love it. (Any)
{@bold Carefree.} Who cares about tomorrow? I live for today. (Chaotic)
{@bold Puppeteer.} I don't care who I have to manipulate or hurt along the way. (Evil)
{@bold Revenge.} Someday, I'll pay back the people who wronged me. (Neutral)
{@bold Curiosity.} People fascinate me, and I love learning what makes them tick. (Any)
The client died, and the blame was put on me. I'll learn the truth.
A friend in my line of work disappeared one day, and I won't just let it go.
I fell in love with a client, but circumstances tore us apart.
Everything I do, I do for my family.
For the longest time, it felt like I was going nowhere. I need to change that.
I will do what I can to elevate others and defend the vulnerable.
I get deeply offended when people reject me.
I'm so used to faking my emotions that even I can't tell when I'm being genuine.
I often let my desires drown out common sense.
Sometimes my playful banter cuts deeper than I intend.
I am slow to make friends, and slower still to trust them.
I interpret people's words as suggestively as possible.

entries: Shrouded in the mysterious depths of dark alleyways, abandoned subways, and fetid sewer tunnels, there exist underground societies which practice the mystical arts. Street shamans come in many forms. You may be a psychic, a fortune teller, a healer, a witch, or any manner of practitioner of the enigmatic and arcane. While some may find your services dubious at best, and profane at worst, there's no denying the demand for them exists.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Religion}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common clothes, an eldritch item (a fetish, a doll, a mask), a set of artisan's tools (one of your choice), and a credit stick with 1000 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Cultish Connoisseur
entries: You can recognize and identify the signs of mystical cults, cabals, orders, and other shadowy groups and their members. You're familiar with several places of power and ritual sites where the border between worlds wears thin. You can always find a dealer of spell components and other arcane goods.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: The demeanor and fashion sense of a street shaman are far more important for their purposes than actually having access to otherworldly powers. No one will believe a guy secretly harbors a host of haunting spirits when he dresses and talks like he works part-time at a gas station. Establishing an air of mystery is crucial.

rows: Why should I tell the truth when lies are more convenient?
I hold deep, unshakeable beliefs about the true nature of the world.
I've been reborn many times, and I sometimes recall things from a past life.
I speak in an enigmatic and ominous tone.
Wear enough dirt and garbage and nobody will look at you twice.
I talk with beings that others can't see.
There's nothing like peaceful meditation and tea after a stressful day.
I'm grouchy because the world made me this way.
There are forces at work to help people. I will be one of them. (Good)
There is a universal equilibrium that is disrupted at our peril. (Lawful)
Gods I can get along with, but religions have too many strictures. (Chaotic)
Dark forces make for good bargains when it comes to gaining power. (Evil)
We are small, unimportant specks in the grander scheme of existence. (Neutral)
I will unfold reality to discover the truth of these worlds. (Any)
I received a vision of something terrible that will occur unless I stop it.
There's a deep imbalance in our society and someone needs to rectify it.
I want to travel the world, see the sights, and plumb its depths.
I am under the effects of a powerful curse that I must cleanse.
People have started vanishing from my usual haunt. Where are they going?
I've got too much blood on my hands to attone. Instead, I obscure my past.
I have witnessed the void, and it has left its taint in me.
I reflexively attempt to weird out others to keep them at a distance.
I have a set of unwritten rules that I expect others to know and follow.
Other people can't handle the truth, I'd better keep it to myself.
I get uncomfortable anywhere with a fancy atmosphere or formal people.

_.special: cheap employee of the month award

entries: Observe the modern wage slave. Packed into cubicles, offices, and behind service desks, they engage in a life-or-death struggle with boredom, impossible deadlines, impatient customers, and sadistic supervisors. They trek home on sketchy subways and vandalized buses to their coffin apartments, spending their meager paychecks on garbage instant noodles, barraged with endless attention-grabbing advertisements along the way.

They devote their precious free hours to watching comfortingly bland sitcoms and playing whatever game is most popular before passing out well after they should have gone to bed. They dream of success, of wealth, of fame, and other things they can never have.
The next day, the cycle begins again.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose two from among {@skill Deception}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Survival}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A set of common clothes, a cheap employee of the month award, a set of artisan's tools (one of your choice), and a credit stick with 500 credits.

entries.name: Feature: Wage Slave Job
entries: Hey, at least you aren't homeless on the mean streets. Love it, hate it, or just tolerate it, you require income from your job in order to live. You may have even been forced to take on multiple jobs. Choose one to three wage slave jobs or roll on the table below to define your 'career'.

entries.name: Feature: Urban Survivor
entries: You know the cheapest thrift stores, pawn shops, restaurants, and other stores where you can find discounts on everyday goods. You're good at finding coupon codes and cut-rate prices for online shopping, event tickets, and public transportation. Additionally, you can make meals even when resources are very limited, such as from a fridge containing only condiments.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Being kept on a constant financial treadmill, where a wage slave's continued employment allows them to just barely keep up with their bills, can do funny things to a person's head, especially when there is little chance of improving their station. Often their lives are marked by a mix of desperation, drudgery, and boredom. While the vast majority of wage slaves are content just to survive, some few may try to pursue their escapist dreams.

rows: I'm usually quiet, and speak when spoken to.
I'm probably the world's biggest fan of...
The emotions I bottle up will eventually escape explosively.
I'm diligent and hardworking, and that's why people like me.
There's always more ways to save money if you look hard enough.
I'm constantly slacking off on the job.
My free time is precious, and I hate when people waste it.
{@bold Fate.} The world wasn't designed for me to succeed. (Any)
{@bold Compassion.} At least I can make someone else's day a little brighter. (Good)
{@bold Citizen.} The best way to get by is to keep your head down. (Lawful)
{@bold Desperation.} I've got nothing to lose. (Chaotic)
{@bold Ruthlessness.} I'd do anything to improve my standard of living. (Evil)
{@bold Passion.} I'm a creature of obsession. (Any)
Important people forget that I'm there, so I overhear a lot of juicy secrets.
I've got a goal for retirement, but it won't be easy to reach.
When I'm in charge, there's going to be some changes around here.
I was fired from my job and I want revenge against my employer.
I'm drowning in debt and I'm willing to go to extremes to get out of it.
I've been waiting my whole life for my time to shine. Finally, I've found my chance.
I can't get through the day sober.
I freeze up when I'm the center of attention.
I don't care what happens to me, my life is pointless anyway.
I'm about as gullible as they come.
I crave approval from others and I'll do anything to get it.
Everyone knows I'm a nobody, and who am I to disagree?

item.name: Demolitionist's tools
entries: This set of tools includes wire cutters, a screwdriver, a small powered drill, electric cabling, and blasting caps. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to arming or disarming explosives and explosive traps.

item.name: Electrician's tools
entries: This set of tools includes a screwdriver set, a soldering iron, 30 feet of universal cable, cable testers, a wire stripper/crimper, and adjustable pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to working with electrical circuits and technical hardware.

item.name: Video game set
entries: This set of elite gamer gear includes a universal controller, a hologram projector, a paper thin video screen, 30 feet of universal cable, and several bottles of aerosol gamer juice. Proficiency with this gaming set allows you to add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play video games.

item.name: Hacking tools
entries: By integrating hacking tools directly into your datajack, you can manipulate a network and the devices connected to it. Hacking tools include an upgrade to your datajack's processing power and a set of hacking applications and programs. See the hacking tools augment in Chapter 3 for information on installing hacking tools.
Attempting to hack without having the hacking tools augment is possible, but more difficult, at your DM's discretion.

entries.name: Attempting to Hack
entries: Hacking a machine or network requires hacking tools, proficiency with hacking tools, and a connection to the target machine or network through a port.
